etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From German Pyrocoll, from pyro- + ancient Greek κόλλα glue

definitions: A yellow, crystalline, heterocyclic compound formed when gelatin is distilled.

notes.text: Pyrocoll has a planar molecule containing three fused rings. Formula: C₁₀H₆N₂O₂.
